lead_paragraph: Protect the Adirondacks, an environmental group, requested inquiries into the 2013 amendment that allowed NYCO Minerals to conduct open-pit mining on state land.
snippet: Protect the Adirondacks, an environmental group, requested inquiries into the 2013 amendment that allowed NYCO Minerals to conduct open-pit mining on state land.

headline.main: 2 Offices Won’t Investigate New York Constitutional Amendment on Adirondack Mining
headline.print_headline: 2 Offices Won’t Investigate State Mining Amendment

abstract: Offices of the New York attorney general and inspector general say they will not open investigations into 2013 constitutional amendment permitting private company NYCO Minerals to carry out open-pit mining on land in Adirondack Mountains owned by New York State; inquiries were requested by environmental group Protect the Adirondacks, one of several opposing amendment.
